results.title: User Researcher
results.description:
What You’ll Accomplish:

  • Work closely with Product Designers and Product Managers to support team-level research objectives and testing needs.
  • Assist Senior User Researcher with higher-level strategic research projects.
  • Support feature teams with mixed method studies (prototype testing, interviews, surveys, etc.)
  • Build research toolkits to empower colleagues to learn and apply research skills, adopt user-centric mindsets, and synthesize previous research findings.
  • Use a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research methods (mixed methods) to uncover user pain points and opportunities (field studies, workshops, ethnography, user testing, etc.).
  • Develop relationships with customers and access in-person sessions with users to explore how they operate in their environment.
  • Receive direction, guidance, and feedback from our senior user researcher on a weekly basis to achieve research objectives.
  • Lead collaborative analysis and synthesis for research findings, communicate results to stakeholders and product team, and contribute to research repository.

Requirements

Who You Are:

  • Ideally you have at least 2-5 years of professional experience working on a research team at a technology company where you were not the only researcher.
  • User Research experience preferably with an eCommerce and/or SaaS, technology company.
  • You have experience with a variety of generative and evaluative research methods, including (but not limited to) in-depth interviews, ideation sessions, customer journey mapping, usability evaluation, surveys, benchmarking, and concept testing.
  • Preferably a degree in a related field (e.g. Behavioral science, social psychology, HCI, CS, UX) and 2-5 years of industry experience or, any equivalent combination of experience and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved.
  • You have clear and concise communication skills.
  • You’ve had success in setting and achieving priorities that find balance between business needs and research objectives while attending to stakeholder needs.
  • You have experience crafting compelling stories to explain your work, process, and decisions to cross-functional stakeholders.

Benefits

Why You Should Join Us:

Our vision is to make it fast and easy for auto repair shops to find the right parts across all of their suppliers with one search. Together, PartsTech’s team helped countless businesses save valuable time so they can focus on their customers — and we’re just getting started.

The PartsTech team is a global, distributed group of passionate self-starters based in Cambridge, Hartford, CT, Eastern Europe and beyond. We are remote-first, privately held and venture-backed.

PartsTech is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and values diversity at every level of our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We believe you should bring your whole self to work, so come as you are.

Benefits:

  • Flexible PTO
  • Health Savings Account or Flexible Spending Account
  • Dependent Care FSA
  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • Supplemental Insurance
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Summer Fridays

results.title: UX Designer
results.description:
Company Description

Our mission is to help people think and feel better about money

Founded in 2020 by experienced fintech founders, Dimply is backed by high-profile industry investors and VCs. We are building tools to help millions of people improve their relationships with money while making them financially happier. To reach as many people as possible, we provide our platform to enterprise customers who use it to help their customers engage with their finances.

At Dimply, you will have a direct impact on our product, our users, our organisation, and our engineering practices.



Job Description

Why You Should Join Our Design Team:

Our team is mighty but small, so your design and input will have a big impact on how the product is shaped. We're culture first at Dimply and a nice bunch of humans who are natural collaborators. You will take an active role in shaping our design culture and the future of thousands of people’s financial happiness. We have implemented server-driven UI (before Airbnb made it popular!) to ensure we can deploy across all platforms quickly with our ever-improving feature list.

You care about helping make a real difference in people's financial lives and are genuinely curious and effective in building complex, scalable systems. You have the unique opportunity to build and scale our core products.

What can you expect:

Simply put, as a strong product designer you will help us design great looking and intuitive products. Your main task will be to work with Dimply’s awesome engineering team to design customer-centric products.

Other responsibilities may also include:

  • Understand product specifications and user psychology
  • Define the right interaction model and evaluate its success
  • Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs
  • Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)
  • Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers
  • Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends
  • Create overall concepts for the user experience within our products
  • Analyze customer responses and product data to determine what visuals perform better than others
  • Design the aesthetics to be implemented within our product, from the layouts and grips to buttons and iconography



Qualifications

What can make you successful in the role

  • Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer or similar role
  • Strong multi-platform portfolio of professional UX/UI design.
  • Experience with product design software as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD or InVision Studio.
  • Experience in design thinking methods.
  • Exceptional creativity, originality and attention to detail.
  • Creative problem-solving skills to find solutions to complex product problems.
  • Strong portfolio of design projects
  • Knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus
  • Problem-solving aptitude
  • Analytical mind with a business acumen
  • Excellent communication skills



Additional Information

Why Dimply?

Besides working with a great bunch of humans, we are a remote-first company. Our team is currently spread across multiple time zones and we feel we are a great place to work! We operate out of Dogpatch Labs in Dublin. When you join, you will receive a work from home budget to help you get set up to be successful. If working from home is not for you and getting to Dogpatch is not ideal, you can avail of our monthly co-working facility support.

results.title: Game7 - Creative Director
results.description:
Who we are

Game7 is an Autonomous GameFi Institution whose treasury is managed and deployed by the community. Our mission is to make web3 gaming sustainable by accelerating the industry towards collaboration, unified standards, open source innovation and having fun.

To achieve this, both BitDAO and Forte have committed $500m to our treasury. Our community then helps decide how to deploy strategic capital towards both Investments and Grants that help drive the ecosystem forward.

As a community, we are passionate about crypto, gaming and are comprised of industry leaders and blockchain experts, who believe there are better ways to build distributed organizations. Our community consists of diverse, talented and intelligent members who’s contributions to the ecosystem help define their governance capabilities.

We’re looking for the next generation of leaders and doers who have a passion for crypto and are looking to influence the future of DAOs, DeFi, Web3 and GameFi. If you’re a self-starter, believe in autonomy and ownership, then we encourage you to apply for this role.

 

About this team

The community is made up of crypto, gaming and DeFi veterans who are passionate about crypto, gaming and distributed entities.

 

Your craft

We’re looking for talented Art Directors who obsess over every pixel, and who have deep experience crafting identities and maintaining brand personalities across multiple mediums and formats including product, events, merchandise, media and more. Your responsibility is to drive artist direction, style guides, and brand guidelines that shape the way the brand is communicated to the public.

  • Min. 5 years experience leading agencies, or teams

  • Web3 and Gaming knowledge or experience

  • Fluent in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite and other Design Tools

  • Excellent time-management and organizational skills

  • Knowledge of online content strategy and creation

  • Proven experience as an Art or Creative Director or related role

If you think you have valuable experience to bring to the organization, but don’t necessarily meet all of the criteria for the role, we still want to hear from you. We consider all applications.

 

Extra credit

If you have experience, knowledge or experience in Web3, Gaming, DeFi, GameFi, DAO’s or other gaming and blockchain specific areas then we consider this an excellent skill set.

 

Why work with us?

We do things a little differently here at Game7, as you’d expect from the blockchain. We promise a culture of flexibility, autonomy, and the freedom to contribute to the wider Web3 ecosystem.

Also: a fully remote working environment. Our compensation packages are reflective of the experience and value you bring to the organization and individual projects.

  • Base pay USDC, paid monthly

  • Work Supplies, HW & Home Office Equipment

  • Co-working space or home office-related expenses

  • Any learning or education materials related to work

  • Travel related expenses that are related to work

  • Any expenses related to food and entertainment for work

  • Any expenses related to both physical or mental health and well-being

 

We’re committed to fostering a progressive work environment that’s centered on forgiveness, empathy, belonging, and psychological well-being. Game7 is an equal opportunities workplace that doesn’t discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: Director of Design - Platform
results.candidate_required_location: USA, Australia and New Zealand, AET (UTC+10)
results.description:
Join us on our mission to make a better world of work. 

Culture Amp revolutionizes how over 25 million employees across 6,000 companies create a better world of work. As the global platform leader for employee experience, Culture Amp empowers companies of all sizes and industries to transform employee engagement, develop high performing teams, and retain talent via cutting-edge research, powerful technology, and the largest employee dataset in the world. The most innovative companies across the globe, such as Salesforce, Unilever, PwC, KIND, SoulCycle, Celonis and BigCommerce depend on Culture Amp every day.

Culture Amp is backed by 10 years of innovation, leading capital venture funds, and offices in the U.S, U.K, Germany and Australia. Culture Amp is recognized as one of the world’s top private cloud companies by Forbes and one of the most innovative workplace companies by Fast Company.

Learn more about how Culture Amp can help you create a better world of work at cultureamp.com.

We have a remote-first culture and this position can be based anywhere from Australia, New Zealand or Pacific Coast USA (AEST-friendly timezones) . This role can be fully remote or a hybrid if you are in Melbourne. We encourage you to work in the way that best suits you

 

How you can help make a better world of work

Join us as the Director of Design for the Platform camp. Platform camp is the group of exceptional Campers who are creating the shared services and data that underpin every experience a user has on our platform.

This means you’ll have a unique opportunity to impact how every employee - HR, managers, and individual employees experience the Culture Amp magic.  

What you’ll spend time doing

  • Collaborate with top notch Product Managers, Designers, Engineers, and People Scientists. 
  • Work through complex problems that demand second and third order thinking e.g. thinking through how roles and permissions support the platform and what experiences they enable.
  • Ensure that the Platform experiences are ‘99% invisible’
  • Help show how shared services and data have a big effect on downstream user experiences 
  • Evolve our shared vision for the Platform experience and how it supports the impact we want to create as a company. 
  • Ensure that valuable experiences are being shipped regularly, meeting the quality standard and are progressing us towards the Platform vision
  • Mentor a team of two to three Product Designers to and help them grow and do their best work
  • Help other members of the camp think about discovery and learn Human Centred Design methods e.g. help teams that deal with Developer Experiences
  • Work cross-functionally with product, engineering and delivery in your Camp and beyond

 

What you bring to Platform

  • Deep experience in design roles
  • You are an established design leader with experience managing people and contributing to cross-functional leadership teams
  • Experience creating end-to-end experiences for users with a leaning toward user- and customer-centred techniques to define and create value, and of using data to validate or test.
  • A toolkit to draw on for deeply understanding problems and defining solutions, such as service design, design-thinking, customer discovery.
  • Empathy for those you work with and mentor, and a drive to build and foster highly-effective teams. 
  • Curiosity and passion for people and culture. At heart, you're what we call a people geek!
  • Iterative and adaptive approach - you’ll get some setbacks, and can reevaluate and find a new path forward without getting too worried about it. 

 

What We Offer

Culture Amp really practices what we preach. We are extremely proud of the Culture we have built, but don't just take our word for it, our Glassdoor reviews speak for themselves!

We want every Camper to feel at home and do their best work at Culture Amp, so we have 4 values that we live by.  You can read more about these at www.cultureamp.com.  Take a read and if this sounds like the environment for you, please apply!

We have a strong commitment to Anti-Racism, and we believe in leading through example. Every step we make as a business towards anti-racism is another step we can support our customers in making a better world of work. You can see our current commitments to Anti-Racism at www.cultureamp.com 

 

But that’s not all!

  • Flexible working hour, make your work schedule work for you
  • 14 weeks parental leave at full pay for primary carers and 4 weeks for secondary carers
  • MacBooks for all
  • Shares - it’s important to us that everyone is an owner and can share in our success.
  • Fun and inclusive digital, and (in the future) in-person events

 

Most importantly. An opportunity to really make a difference in people’s lives.

Please keep reading...

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Locations: Canada (Remote) 

Salary: $110-130,000 CAD ($80-95,000 USD) (based on experience) + Equity + Benefits

 

About Us

Just Appraised is a Y Combinator-backed startup that is building trust and transparency between governments and the communities they serve. We do this by providing local government employees with tools to do their jobs better. Our software makes critical tax assessors’ workflows 10x faster and much more enjoyable for employees in the tax office to complete, and creates trust and transparency with the public by making it easy for anyone to understand how their property taxes are calculated.

 

The Role

We are actively seeking a highly-motivated, shipping-oriented Senior Product Designer excited to shape the product design vision and strategy in their product area. The scope of this role will include all aspects of our web-based product suite, including new features, new product development, and product enhancements, as well as maturing our design team with mentorship. The successful candidate will be at the forefront of product thought leadership, focusing on value to the customer, and overall usability of our product. Our main users are local government employees and property-owning tax payers in their jurisdiction, which means that we value efficiency, efficacy, accessibility, and simplicity, in order to deliver value to them. 

Please Note: This position requires overlap with our Canada/US team. Your work hours must overlap with the hours of 7 am ET & 8 pm ET (you are not expected to work the entire time! Any full-time shift in this window will work). 

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with your cross-functional team to shape product design vision and strategy in your product area
  • Create high quality designs and prototypes, while informing the design process
  • Conduct user research through customer and prospect demos, and gather insights to circulate to the Product and Engineering teams
  • Give and solicit constructive feedback from other designers to continually raise our bar for quality
  • Provide mentorship to more junior designers
  • Inspire your team to push the boundaries of UX quality
  • Build and maintain a robust, consistent design system

What We Value

  • 3-6+ years of professional hands-on design experience at a B2B SaaS or Enterprise-grade software company
  • Strong portfolio of product design work for multiple launched products of web browser-based applications for businesses, with a subscription model
  • Strong communication skills for articulating design methodologies and advocating for the importance of good UX
  • Experience executing on cross-functional work
  • Experience building and maintaining a mature design system
    • Track record of scaling up a design system
    • Able to define a long-term strategy for a scalable UX

Nice to Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in fields such as HCI, UX, Interaction Designer
  • Experience working with government entities or for government clients

 

Our Culture

We are passionate about building a diverse and inclusive environment. We are looking for teammates who care about encouraging different points of view, engaging in healthy debate, and want to work on the hard skills of practicing inclusion on a daily basis.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
PRODUCT DESIGNER

We are seeking a mid-weight Product Designer looking to build the next generation of 3D projects. The ideal candidate will have a holistic approach to product design, and a portfolio that covers both UX and UI processes. We are also conducting user research, so experience in user research is preferable but not essential.

Responsibilities

This position will report to the Head of Design and will work with cross-functional team members such as Technical engineering heads, product owners, etc.

● Maintain and improve large design libraries

● Create new components for high-fidelity mockups

● Identify new product improvement opportunities

● Analyze how a new product satisfies market needs and consumer preferences

● Stay up to date on current industry trends and market conditions

● Work closely with senior designers

● Coordinate with product engineers

● Present ideas to cross-functional teams and senior leadership

Requirements

This is a mid-weight position, so we expect you to have around 3 years experience as a UX/UI or Product Designer

● Good knowledge of accessibility, usability and design patterns.

● Good Figma skills – we do everything in Figma ✨.

● Experience working with design systems and shared libraries.

● Skilled at creating components and working with variants and instances.

● Ideally you’re also a wizard with auto-layout and responsive design. You always consider

different screen sizes.

● A well-rounded portfolio of client work – we work with many different stakeholders and

teams, so you must be comfortable working on varied projects.

● Ability to think through a problem by crafting user stories, user flows and wireframes.

● Creativity and willingness to push the visual design. We want to make beautiful and

delightful apps.

● Passion for design. Fortunately, we work in an industry that’s open to new ideas, so if

you want to try something weird, we’ll probably enjoy it.

Benefits

● 100% remote & flexible hours

● Growing challenging environment

● Learning possibilities (conferences, meetups, courses, etc.)

● Additional equipment

● Paid days off

results.title: Production Designer
results.description:
At Gigasavvy, our Creative Team does much more than create pretty designs. We strive to understand every aspect of the consumer journey. We are storytellers at heart who love to create belief in our clients’ products and services.

As a member of the team, the Production Designer will do everything from the creation of design mocks for social & digital campaigns, to website design, print, packaging, as well as brand identity and creative campaign ideations.

The Production Designer's PASSION for marketing and advertising, the desire to make great work, and how this person solves problems on a daily basis are all key factors in thriving at Gigasavvy.


Core Responsibilities

  • Collaborate closely with art directors, designers, account managers and brand strategists
  • Prepare final press-ready files based on supplied specifications for several types of printing
  • Make various formats of supplied artwork production-ready and resolve any artwork issues that arise during production
  • Provide image retouching, clipping paths and additional image manipulation
  • Package and preflight files for release to printers or media partners
  • Create PDFs for print and client review
  • Prepare images for online and mobile applications
  • Follow a development timeline to ensure tasks are being completed on time
  • Troubleshoot problems as they arise with both the creative team and the printer
  • Develop and grow other design skills such as animation and after effects


Qualities

The ideal candidate has:

  • A passion for design and creative marketing
  • A drive to learn and adapt to a fast-paced environment
  • A desire to seek inspiration and share that inspiration with others
  • A humble and hungry attitude
  • A proactive approach to addressing problems before they arise
  • A love for what you do

Requirements

  • BA/BS degree required (design concentration preferred)
  • 2-4 years of experience as Production Artist within a product company, design studio, creative agency, printing company or print publication
  • Experience with digital content such as websites, social media, rich media, online advertising and email campaigns
  • Proficient in Photoshop, Illustrator, & InDesign
  • Ideally, familiar with After Effects & Premiere
  • Experience working in an agency environment is a plus
  • Ability to multi-task on a daily basis
  • Collaborates well with a team
  • Willingness to learn and adjust to complex situations on the fly
  • Drive to challenge current design trends (what makes them work)
  • Ability to present ideas and concepts both internally and directly to clients
  • Ability to effectively communicate timelines and the status of projects
  • Proven ability to ensure that brand voice, concepts, themes and/or messaging are accurately represented in design
  • Expertise in managing multiple assigned project tasks in a strict deadline-driven environment
  • A positive disposition in a fast-paced environment and during demanding times
  • Innovative, creative, resourceful and accountable with an insistence on honesty, transparency, and integrity in work ethic

Benefits

  • Digitally-driven remote working environment, made possible by a transparent and collaborative work culture
  • Becoming an integral part of a cutting edge marketing agency
  • Working with a talented, passionate, collaborative team
  • Casual and flexible working conditions, allowing you to customize your workday
  • Excellent benefits including health, dental, vision and 401(k)
  • Unlimited time off policy and generous paid holidays

results.title: Lead Game Designer - Shooter
results.description:
Carry1st is Africa’s leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, fintech, and web3, we scale awesome content in underserved frontier markets. Carry1st has a proprietary payments and ecommerce platform which allows players to acquire global content using locally-accessible payment methods. We are backed by awesome investors like: Andreessen Horowitz, Google, Riot Games, Avenir, Konvoy Ventures, and Nas.

As Lead Game Designer you’ll be responsible for defining and guiding the creation of a fast paced first person shooter that will be played by millions of players.

You’ll work in close collaboration with our awesome Product, Creative, and Engineering teams, using your design skills, product mentality, and passion for mobile games to design the gameplay features at every stage of the process.

From contributing design documentation, through facilitating implementation and content creation, to managing game data – you will be an integral part in ensuring the successful delivery of the game.

You will…

  • Lead the design of an exciting new mobile shooter with overall responsibility of creating an amazing game experience and engaging player journey
  • Be the owner of the core combat gameplay, responsible of making it fun and addictive
  • Design and tune all core gameplay aspects (Combat, Weapons, Movements, Maps, Enemy’s AI)
  • Contribute to the definition and optimization of game’s economy and progression systems
  • Write detailed focused design specifications that effectively communicate multi-disciplinary design goals and meet the player’s needs
  • Collaborate with engineering to support feature implementation, helping to identify and resolve design challenges and edge-cases

Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?

  • 4+ years of Game Design experience in FPS or mid-core games
  • Deep familiarity with shooters with past work experience in shooters gameplay design
  • Understanding of multiple aspects of game design discipline that contribute to the success of mobile shooters ranging from F2P economy design to enemy AI scripting
  • A good eye for visual and UX details
  • Strong analytical abilities and able to synthesize game systems and mechanics to improve game features and systems

Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-growing, dynamic place to work. And while we are laser focused on building the flagship mobile internet company in Africa, our team is fully remote and 100% global - with people in 20+ countries! At Carry1st, you will…

  • Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
  • Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming, fintech, and web3
  • Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
  • Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create

Some additional perks…

  • Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
  • Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively
  • Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
  • Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
  • Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
  • Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day

We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn more about Carry1st…

  • Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
  • Bloomberg announced that Nas and Google joined Carry1st’s $20M round
  • Quartz reported on Carry1st and the potential of the African gaming market

results.title: Environment Artist
results.description:
ABOUT US
 
Mountaintop is a new game studio creating multiplayer games for players that crave a challenge. We’re an independent, remote-first studio primarily located in the US.
 
We’re creating the types of games that bring people together — and keep them together for “just one more round.” The types of games that inspired us as kids. The games that become our hobbies, and sometimes our obsessions.
 
Games are a reflection of the teams that make them. So to make the best games, we’re building a studio that puts the team first — one that's collaborative, anti-crunch, diverse, and inclusive.
 
We’d love for you to join us
 



THE ROLE
  • We’re looking for an Environment Artist who’s passionate about building extraordinary new experiences that inspire others. Awesome environments make for great games, so you’ll play a crucial role in bringing our first title to life.



YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR
  • Modeling, texturing, creating UVs, and engine implementation of stylized environment assets for a game developed with the Unreal Engine
  • Collaborate with level designers to populate environments
  • Review and incorporate assets from third-party vendors.
  • Closely collaborate with production to maintain a transparent and reliable schedule
  • Contributing to a team culture that prides itself on excellence, innovation, trust, and respect
 



ABOUT YOU
  • A love for playing and making amazing games
  • A passion for creating amazing environments
  • Expert-level knowledge of environment modeling and scene composition
  • Expert-level knowledge of texturing in Substance Painter and Designer
  • Solid understanding of asset optimization techniques/challenges
  • Mastery over vertex normals' impact on low poly shading
  • Strong organizational and communication skills
  • Thrive in a team-oriented, creative environment
  • Self-motivated, with great time management skills
  • Willing to take risks and learn from failure
 



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Strong portfolio of realistic and stylized environments for games
  • AAA game development experience a plus
  • Shooter game experience
  • Experience developing and maintaining shaders
 
PERKS
 
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance (100% of premiums paid)
401k plan
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Unlimited PTO
Remote-work Friendly

results.title: Senior Gameplay Designer
results.description:
Company Description

To create revolutionary, story-driven RPGs which go straight to the hearts of gamers — this is our mission. As a driven team of talented professionals from all around the globe, we want to earn our place as one of the world’s top video-game developers, push narrative boundaries, and build unforgettable stories that set and redefine the standards for the genre.



Job Description

CD PROJEKT RED is looking for a talented and passionate Senior Gameplay Designer to join our team and help us develop a new game in the Witcher Saga! If you are ready to take on such a challenge, don’t hesitate and apply! :)

Daily Responsibilities: 

  • Proposing and documenting an innovative design for systems and features that follows the game direction. 
  • Iterating and improving documentation for existing systems and features.
  • Designing, prototyping, scripting, iterating on features using a Unreal Engine 5. 
  • Working in multidisciplinary teams on prototyping and implementing stages, ensuring that the gameplay functionality, combat systems, as well as the overall gameplay experience are carried through to completion in the highest possible quality.
  • Taking ownership of specific features/systems of game. 



Qualifications
  • At least 5 years of professional experience in the game industry.
  • Proven success in creating compelling and innovative gameplay mechanics.
  • Understanding programming/scripting in game design and experience with game editors and game design tools.
  • Experience in working with Unreal Engine 4 and/or Unreal Engine 5. 
  • Experience with combat, narrative, multiplayer and/or action design.
  • Openness to receiving and giving feedback about your work.
  • Ability to include others in the design process.
  • Mentoring experience. 
  • Openness for changes & experimentation, high-quality passion and a good sense of humor are appreciated!



Additional Information

Working mode

For this role you can choose between a remote-first or office-first working mode.

  • Office-First: working primarily from the Warsaw, Wroclaw, or Cracow studio for a minimum of 10 days per month.
  • Remote-First: working from home, or from any location that is within 3 hours of the GMT+2 time zone.

Perks & Professional Growth

  • Flexible working hours — start your workday anytime between 8:00 and 10:00 AM.
  • A welcome pack filled with goodies — to help you feel right at home once you join the team.
  • Trainings, lectures and courses — internal workshops, external training for each employee, ‘Meet a star’ events, knowledge-sharing initiatives, online tutorials, and e-learning classes are all available. There’s always something to learn!
  • Merch — employee store discounts at CD PROJEKT RED Gear, gifts for newborn rebels and regular chances to nab some cool swag!

Health & Well-being

  • Private medical healthcare — a selection of medical plans with dental care to choose from, which are also accessible for your partner and relatives.
  • Support during COVID-19 — regular tests and COVID vaccinations at the studio as well as professional advice and guidance from a specialist doctor.
  • Psychological care — free mental health support and various well-being webinars. 
  • Multisport card — gain access to a wide number of sporting and fitness facilities across the city.

Social Activities & Life in the Office

  • Dog-friendly office — dog owner? Bring your pooch with you and look after them while working! There’s always a furry friend or two to meet at the studio.
  • Social events — we host regular gatherings at the studio where we can all unwind, play games, and just have some fun together.
  • Healthy selections — ​​organic fruit, snacks, muesli, organic honey, vegan milk, and specialty coffee are all at your disposal around the studio. Enjoy!
  • Truly international working environment — a chance to meet and work with a diverse selection of people from all around the world.

Head office in Warsaw

  • Sustainable campus with an eco ethos — solar panels provide green energy, 2000 plants and an air-filtering system to help provide clean air, electric car charging points, flower meadows, and more green features in the works.
  • An onsite, well-equipped gym with a climbing wall and a personal trainer available every day and pilates classes.
  • Car and bike parking spaces.
  • A designated space for your bicycle, as well as bicycle repair equipment and showers available whenever you need them.
